unnormalised: What are some practical ways to improve waste management in India?
normalised: What are some practical ways to improve waste management in India?

unnormalised: Okay guys, let's talk about Kachra! Seriously though, waste management in India is a HUGE challenge, especially in cities like Mumbai and Delhi. We see overflowing bins and mountains of garbage everywhere. What can we, as ordinary citizens, do to improve things?
normalised: Okay guys, let's talk about Kachra! Seriously though, waste management in India is a huge challenge, especially in cities like Mumbai and Delhi. We see overflowing bins and mountains of garbage everywhere. What can we, as ordinary citizens, do to improve things?

unnormalised: Firstly, segregation at source is crucial. We need to separate wet and dry waste religiously. Like, my didi, Priya, at IIT Bombay, keeps yelling about it! She says even a tiny bit of mixed waste messes up the whole recycling process.
normalised: Firstly, segregation at source is crucial. We need to separate wet and dry waste religiously. Like, my didi, Priya, at I I T Bombay, keeps yelling about it! She says even a tiny bit of mixed waste messes up the whole recycling process.

unnormalised: Secondly, composting! My nani used to compost all her kitchen waste, and her garden was blooming! Small-scale composting units can be set up in apartments and neighbourhoods.
normalised: Secondly, composting! My nani used to compost all her kitchen waste, and her garden was blooming! Small-scale composting units can be set up in apartments and neighbourhoods.

unnormalised: Thirdly, say NO to single-use plastics! Carry your own bag when you go shopping at the local sabzi mandi. It's easier than you think. And maybe stop ordering chai in those plastic cups. Kulhads are so much better, and more traditional!
normalised: Thirdly, say N O to single-use plastics! Carry your own bag when you go shopping at the local sabzi mandi. It's easier than you think. And maybe stop ordering chai in those plastic cups. Kulhads are so much better, and more traditional!

unnormalised: Fourthly, advocate for better waste management systems in your locality. Pressure your local corporator to do something!
normalised: Fourthly, advocate for better waste management systems in your locality. Pressure your local corporator to do something!

unnormalised: Finally, be mindful of what you consume. Are you really going to eat that third samosa? (Okay, maybe you are, but think about the packaging!).
normalised: Finally, be mindful of what you consume. Are you really going to eat that third samosa? (Okay, maybe you are, but think about the packaging!).

unnormalised: Remember that garbage mountain in the movie "Dil Dhadakne Do"? Let's not let India turn into that. Every little bit helps! What are your thoughts?
